fact_list.fact_text: Children are vulnerable road users with limited experience using the roads, making school zone safety a paramount importance.
Several road engineering measures have been installed in school zones to enhance safety.
Drivers should slow down and drive very carefully in school zones.
Drivers should be extra vigilant in watching out for children crossing the road in school zones, as their height may block them from view.
Drivers should be patient when encountering heavy traffic at school zones during school peak hours.
Drivers rushing for time should take other routes if possible.
Drivers should ensure their child alights at safe and proper drop-off points when driving them to school.
Silver zones are designated areas with enhanced road safety engineering measures to make streets safer and more convenient for senior pedestrians to cross.
Silver zones are located in selected housing estates with a high senior population, relatively higher accident rates involving seniors, and proximity to places where seniors frequent.
Several road safety engineering measures have been installed in silver zones to enhance road safety for senior pedestrians and all road users.
Drivers should drive slow and carefully within silver zones, especially near crossings.
Drivers should be extra vigilant in watching out for all pedestrians, especially senior pedestrians crossing the road in silver zones.
Drivers should be patient with senior pedestrians crossing within silver zones, as they may require more time to cross.
